page.title: 17ECOLOGY OF SWINFORD
page.content: {WILD ANIMALS}in the Swinford Area bat, badger, brown rat, fox, grey squirrel, hare, hedghog, house mouse, mole, muntjac deer, rabbit, stoat, shrew, pygmy shrew, water shrew, wood mouse, bank vole, water vole, short tailed vole and weasel. {FISH}- The{Stanford Reservoir}and {River Avon} are venues for fishermen catching perch, roach, gudgeon, pike, tench, bream, dace, trout and minnow. {BIRDS}- blackbird, crow, magpie, wren, collared dove, tree creeper, nuthatch, great spotted woodpecker, greenfinch, jackdaw, song thrush, mistle thrush, partridge, pheasant, robin, chaffinch, rook, sparrow, starling, wood pigeon, blue, great and long tailed tits and yellow hammer.{Summer migrants}cuckoo, swallow, house martin, hoopoe, swift, goldcrest, meadow pipit, whitethroat, willow warbler and yellow wagtail.
